name: American Near East Refugee Aid (Anera)
mission:
Since 1968, Anera has helped refugees and others hurt by conflicts in the Middle East live with dignity and purpose.
Anera, which has no political or religious affiliation, works on the ground with partners in Palestine (West Bank and Gaza), Lebanon and Jordan. We mobilize resources for immediate emergency relief and for sustainable, long-term health, education, and economic development. Our staff serve in their communities, navigating the politics that constrict progress to get help where it's needed most. That's how Anera delivered more than $100.4 million in programs in 2020 alone, and it's how we will keep building better lives until hope finds its way in the Middle East.
theoryOfChange: Anera conducts assessments to inform its program strategies, such as the 'Tech Ecosystem in Palestine' report, which was conducted to inform their career accelerator program strategy. This indicates a documented approach to how their programs create impact. Anera also states its commitment to providing impactful, sustainable programs and aligns its work with the Sustainable Development Goals. Their 'On-the-Ground Reports' detail their responses and priorities based on identified needs.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.anera.org/zakat (Source: https://www.anera.org/zakat)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Strong donor fit, low risk profile, and credible supporting evidence for outcomes.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.

components.name: Financial Health

score_details.score_summary: American Near East Refugee Aid (Anera) shows exceptional alignment and good impact, with zakat compliance.

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.anera.org/zakat (Source: https://www.anera.org/zakat)

all_citations.claim: Anera holds a 100.0/100 from Charity Navigator score and maintains a 96.3% program expense ratio.
Anera is Zakat-eligible and provides information on its zakat policy and asnaf categories.
The organization reported total revenue of $173,279,297 and detailed its program expenses.
Anera has a long history of distributing in-kind contributions and medical supplies.
Anera offers various giving methods and donation options for supporters.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Anera earns a strong overall score due to its perfect financial health rating and deep alignment with humanitarian needs, though its impact score is moderated by a high cost per beneficiary.
areas_for_improvement: Relatively low working capital of 1.2 months, which may limit long-term financial flexibility during sudden crises.
High cost per beneficiary relative to some other humanitarian interventions.

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization shows high donor fit for those prioritizing Middle Eastern humanitarian causes and is Zakat-eligible, offering specific programs that adhere to asnaf categories [2][14]. Its long track record since 1968 and focus on urgent conflict zones contribute to a high alignment score [1][3].
dimension_explanations.impact: Anera demonstrates high directness through the provision of medical supplies, education, and emergency relief, reporting a total revenue of $173,279,297 [1][3]. While it maintains a 96.3% program expense ratio, the calculated cost per beneficiary is approximately $17,588, reflecting the intensive nature of its infrastructure and medical interventions [1][4].

baseline_narrative.headline: American Near East Refugee Aid (Anera) provides critical humanitarian relief and sustainable development to refugees and vulnerable communities across the Middle East.
strengths: Exceptional program expense ratio of 96.3%, ensuring the vast majority of funds reach beneficiaries.
Highly efficient fundraising operations with a cost of only $0.01 per $1 raised.
Verified Zakat-eligible status with clear policies for Sharia-compliant giving.
baseline_narrative.summary: founded in 1968, Anera delivers large-scale health, education, and economic development programs to those affected by conflict in Palestine, Lebanon, and Jordan [1][3]. The organization is recognized for its high level of transparency and financial efficiency, maintaining a 100/100 rating from Charity Navigator [1].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Anera earns a strong overall score due to its perfect financial health rating and deep alignment with humanitarian needs, though its impact score is moderated by a high cost per beneficiary.

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization operates with relatively lean reserves of <cite id="1">1.2 months of working capital</cite>, which may limit flexibility during sudden, protracted crises.

bbb_assessment.summary: Maintains strong governance and financial oversight.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization's massive scale and consistent revenue growth help mitigate short-term liquidity risks.
risk_factors: <cite id="1">Lean working capital reserves</cite> could pose challenges during sudden funding disruptions.
case_against.summary: The primary operational constraint is the organization's lean financial reserves, maintaining only <cite id="1">1.2 months of working capital</cite>.

confidence.data_freshness: Data is current through 2023 tax year
confidence.notes: Extremely high confidence due to perfect transparency scores and consistent financial reporting.

known_gaps: No rigorous third-party RCT impact evaluations

alignment.explanation: Strong fit for Muslim donors with <cite id="2">verified zakat-eligible programs</cite> serving high-urgency humanitarian needs in Palestine, Lebanon, and Jordan.
alignment.improvement: Expand services to additional underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust Anera due to its <cite id="1">100/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, PLATINUM Candid seal, and decades of <cite id="4">audited financial statements</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility further, the charity could publish more granular, independent impact evaluations of its long-term development projects.

impact.explanation: Operations show an unmatched <cite id="3">96.3% program expense ratio</cite> and highly efficient fundraising at <cite id="1">$0.01 per $1 raised</cite>.
impact.improvement: Build reserves toward a board-approved target range to improve the current <cite id="1">1.2 months of working capital</cite>.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Tracked outcomes and clear theory of change

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Primarily direct provision of services rather than grantmaking.

rich_narrative.headline: American Near East Refugee Aid (Anera) provides critical humanitarian relief and sustainable development to refugees and vulnerable communities across the Middle East.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to maximize the financial efficiency of their zakat by supporting a massive, established institution delivering direct humanitarian aid to Palestinian and regional refugees.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat obligations with confidence
Prioritize organizations with near-perfect financial efficiency metrics
Care deeply about humanitarian crises in Palestine, Lebanon, and Jordan
Value established institutions with decades of operational history
giving_considerations: Large-scale operations mean individual gifts join a massive pooled fund
Programs operate in highly volatile regions with access challenges
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking hyperlocal US community impact or those who prefer funding grassroots, startup NGOs.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The organization tracks outcomes and has a clear theory of change, but lacks rigorous third-party RCT evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Anera delivers direct humanitarian relief and sustainable development programs to refugees and vulnerable communities to help them live with dignity.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that highly efficient financial operations translate into meaningful, long-term improvements in beneficiary lives.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: Ongoing and escalating crises in the Middle East ensure that humanitarian needs far exceed current funding capacity.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by a <cite id="3">96.3% program expense ratio</cite> compared to the <cite id="1">89.8% peer program ratio median</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar focus on humanitarian relief with a broader global footprint.
similar_organizations.name: Action Against Hunger USA

similar_organizations.differentiator: UN-mandated agency serving the same specific demographic.
similar_organizations.name: UNRWA

strengths.detail: The organization operates with a <cite id="3">96.3% program expense ratio</cite> and an incredibly low fundraising cost of <cite id="1">$0.01 per $1 raised</cite>, maximizing donor impact.
Anera maintains a <cite id="1">100/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and holds a PLATINUM Seal of Transparency from Candid.
The charity provides <cite id="2">verified zakat-eligible programs</cite> serving the fuqara and masakin in crisis zones.

strengths_deep_dive: Anera's operational model is highly optimized for direct aid delivery. By leveraging massive in-kind medical contributions and established local networks, the organization achieves a <cite id="3">96.3% program expense ratio</cite>, far exceeding the <cite id="1">89.8% peer program ratio median</cite>. This efficiency is coupled with strong institutional growth, evidenced by a <cite id="3">24.1% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: American Near East Refugee Aid (Anera), <cite id="3">founded in 1968</cite>, provides critical humanitarian relief and sustainable development to refugees and vulnerable communities across the Middle East, specifically in Palestine, Lebanon, and Jordan. The organization operates at a massive scale, reporting <cite id="3">$173,279,297 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year. Anera is distinguished by its extraordinary financial efficiency, maintaining a <cite id="3">96.3% program expense ratio</cite>, ensuring that virtually all funding is directed toward its core mission of humanitarian relief. Furthermore, its fundraising operations are highly optimized, costing just <cite id="1">$0.01 per $1 raised</cite>. The organization has experienced significant recent growth, demonstrating a <cite id="3">24.1% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite>. Donors can give with high confidence, as Anera has earned a <cite id="1">100/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and holds a PLATINUM Seal of Transparency from Candid. For Muslim donors, the organization offers <cite id="2">verified zakat-eligible programs</cite> that support vulnerable populations falling under the categories of fuqara, masakin, and ibn_sabil. With decades of experience navigating complex geopolitical environments, Anera remains a premier institution for delivering direct provision of medical supplies, education, and emergency aid to the region.
